name: s3eq2
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3
body: |- wi(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(cs3(c2, c0, c3), cs3(c2, c1, c3)))

stmt.origin: s3eqd(c2, c0, c3, c2, c1, c3, wceq(c0, c1))
stmt.pretty: s3eqd(c2, c0, c3, c2, c1, c3, c0 = c1)

body.origin:
|- wi(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(cs3(c2, c0, c3), cs3(c2, c1, c3)))
-| wi(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(c2, c2))
-| wi(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(c0, c1))
-| wi(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(c3, c3))

|- wi(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(cs3(c2, c0, c3), cs3(c2, c1, c3)))

-| wi(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(c0, c1))
-| wi(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(c3, c3))

|- wi(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(cs3(c2, c0, c3), cs3(c2, c1, c3)))

-| wi(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(c3, c3))

|- wi(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(cs3(c2, c0, c3), cs3(c2, c1, c3)))

comment: Equality theorem for a length 3 word for the second symbol. (Contributed by AV, 4-Jan-2022.)
